title: Galltrit
data:

* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.

| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | SLASH 6 monst.c#line544                                                                                 |

The **galltrit** is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that first appeared in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), the precursor to [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It is not part of [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Code for the monster appears in the source for SLASH'EM, but the code is commented out, making it a [deferred feature](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature").

Galltrits are included in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Origin](#Origin)
- [3 Encyclopedia](#Encyclopedia)
- [4 References](#References)
- [5 See also](#See_also)

## Description

The galltrit's attacks are identical to those of the [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin"): three [physical](/wiki/Physical_damage "Physical damage") attacks, followed by an [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic")-stealing attack.

## Origin

The galltrit comes from D\&D. It is a tiny (about six inches tall) blood-sucking gremlin. The in-game galltrit is [no smaller than](/wiki/Size "Size") an ordinary gremlin, however.

## Encyclopedia

A faster, but less hardy variety of the common gremlin.

## References

- NetHack 3.4.3 monst.c line 412
- SLASH 6 monst.c#line 544
- SLASH 6 monstr.c#line 9
- SLASH 6 data#line 204

## See also

- [Jermlaine](/wiki/Jermlaine "Jermlaine"), another deferred SLASH'EM monster from SLASH 6

Galltrit

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Galltrit
g galltrit (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks Claw 1d6 physical, Claw 1d6 physical, Bite 1d4, Claw 0d0 steal intrinsic
g galltrit (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Claw 1d6 physical, Claw 1d6 physical, Bite 1d4, Claw 0d0 steal intrinsic

Base level 3

Speed 18
Base AC 2
Base MR 25
Alignment -9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 20
Size Small
Resistances poison

A galltrit:

  • can swim.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • can follow you to other levels.
Reference SLASH 6 monst.c#line544

The galltrit is a monster that first appeared in SLASH 6, the precursor to SLASH'EM. It is not part of NetHack 3.4.3. Code for the monster appears in the source for SLASH'EM, but the code is commented out, making it a deferred feature.

Galltrits are included in SlashTHEM.

The '''galltrit''' is a [[monster]] that first appeared in [[SLASH 6]], the precursor to [[SLASH'EM]].  It is not part of [[NetHack 3.4.3]].  Code for the monster appears in the source for SLASH'EM, but the code is commented out, making it a [[deferred feature]].  

Galltrits are included in [[SlashTHEM]].

==Description==
The galltrit's attacks are identical to those of the [[gremlin]]: three [[Physical damage|physical]] attacks, followed by an [[intrinsic]]-stealing attack.

==Origin==
The galltrit comes from D&D.  It is a tiny (about six inches tall) blood-sucking gremlin.  The in-game galltrit is [[Size|no smaller than]] an ordinary gremlin, however.

==Encyclopedia==
{{encyclopedia|
A faster, but less hardy variety of the common gremlin.}}
